body.p:
Robert Cochrans Spencer County, Ky. Decr 18th 1864
Gov Bramlette

My friend Geo Anderson of this County has this morning called ^on^me for a letter of introduction to you, he informs me that his Son joined a recruiting Officer who claimed to belong to Jessee -- while on a Spree and was the next day Captured by Bridwater on the highway without weapons. Mr Anderson is a gentleman and will represent the facts to you correctly. Mr A advocated your election for Govener to my personal knowledge and has all the time that I have known him advocated perfect obedience to all Federal and State laws and & Military orders, I am intimately acquainted with Mr Anderson and know that he went further than I could endorse in the advocacy of the present Administration, Any favour consistent with duty grnated to Mr Anderson will not be dishonored by him, I feel for him as good citizen, His house was my place of refuge the night I escaped from the Guerrillas after my brutal treatment by them He has from the commencement been my friend.
P S excuse a miserable pen

Spencer County Ky
>Dec 18" 1864
Anderson Geo W
Miller Otho
To the Govr
Introduces Mr Geo. Anderson -- you can rely upon what he may state to you --
